meanings.definition: In a way that causes vomiting.
meanings.sent1: She felt emetically after eating the spoiled food.
meanings.sent2: The medicine worked emetically, making her throw up.
meanings.sent3: The roller coaster ride was so intense, it made her feel emetically.
meanings.sent4: The news of her failed exam hit her emetically.
meanings.sent5: The smell of rotten eggs was emetically nauseating.

meanings.definition: Relating to or used to induce vomiting.
meanings.sent1: The emetically flavored syrup was given to induce vomiting.
meanings.sent2: The emetically scented candle made her feel queasy.
meanings.sent3: The emetically designed poster was meant to provoke a reaction.
meanings.sent4: The emetically colored drink looked unappetizing.
meanings.sent5: The emetically labeled bottle warned of its contents.
